summary: This bill, the Protecting and Preserving Social Security Act (H.R. 4968), aims to improve the Social Security program. Key provisions include transitioning to a Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers (CPI-E) to calculate cost-of-living adjustments, affecting benefits for the elderly. It also modifies how wages and self-employment income above the contribution and benefit base are determined after 2025. Furthermore, it incorporates surplus earnings into the Social Security benefit formula and addresses related effective dates for these changes.
